metadata.title: CVE-2024-26846 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-fc: do not wait in vain when unloading moduleThe module exit path has race between deleting all controllers andfreeing 'left over IDs'. To prevent double free a synchronizationbetween nvme_delete_ctrl and ida_destroy has been added by the initialcommit.There is some logic around trying to prevent from hanging forever inwait_for_completion, though it does not handling all cases. E.g.blktests is able to reproduce the situation where the module unloadhangs forever.If we completely rely on the cleanup code executed from thenvme_delete_ctrl path, all IDs will be freed eventually. This makescalling ida_destroy unnecessary. We only have to ensure that allnvme_delete_ctrl code has been executed before we leavenvme_fc_exit_module. This is done by flushing the nvme_delete_wqworkqueue.While at it, remove the unused nvme_fc_wq workqueue too.
